author: wired blogs
text: date: mon, 13 dec 1999 17:35:48 gmt from: "cyber warrior" (cyberwarrior5@hotmail.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: nsa articlei don't know who wrote the article about excesses by nsa ("spies left out in the cold," 13.dec.99), but he or she could not have been further from the mark. true, there were excesses before the mid-'70s, but since then our government has enacted regulations that strictly prohibit domestic spying. these regulations are not without substance. every dod employee involved in gathering communications intelligence must review and pass a test on these regulations at least once a year. us intelligence agencies (particularly nsa) take safeguarding the privacy of american citizens very seriously. the improper use of our nation's intelligence capabilities in the '50s, '60s, and early '70s was the result of right wing paranoia in our government.articles like the one published by you today are the result of left-wing paranoia, and are a disservice to the intelligence professionals whose task it is to defend them.
